snippet: A new study finds that bringing blood pressure down below current recommendations may greatly reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke.
abstract: Study conducted by National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute suggests people can lower their risk of heart attack and stroke by reducing blood pressure to below 120 rather than current guideline of 140; data will be published in next few months.
lead_paragraph: A new study finds that bringing blood pressure down below current recommendations may greatly reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke.

headline.main: Lower Blood Pressure Guidelines Could Be ‘Lifesaving,’ Federal Study Says
headline.print_headline: Study Testing Blood Pressure Says Go Lower

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute
